alert.note: Alert for Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 17 at 10:20AM CST until further notice by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... Niobrara River near Sparks affecting Cherry County. .An ice jam will cause water to infiltrate the lowlands along the river. For the Niobrara River...including Sparks...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Niobrara River near Sparks. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flood stage. Minor flooding along the lower banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CST Wednesday /8:15 AM MST Wednesday/ the stage was 6.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 6.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 AM CST Wednesday /8:15 AM MST Wednesday/ was 6.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady at flood stage. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.3 feet on 03/08/1989. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Niobrara River Sparks 6.0 6.3 Wed 9 am CST 6.0 6.0 6.0 &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late Wednesday evening.this evening at 1030 PM CST /930 PM MST/.
